metadata.title: Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic
metadata.description: An integer can be written as a product of primes in a unique way.

document.title: Proof
document.text:
$n = p_1p_2\ldots = q_1q_2\ldots$

By Euclid's lemma, every $p_i$ must divide a $q_j$. We can prove this theorem using mathematical induction.

See [complete proof on Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fundamental_theorem_of_arithmetic).
